title: Creativity House
description: Situational Questions in Professional Project Management

test.text:
An agile project is running its fifth iteration out of 1. After the last retrospective, the team members realize that they had to work extra hours to deliver the committed work.
What should the project manager do?

choices.text: Ask the team to have a lower commitment for the next iteration.
Ask for additional team members to maintain the velocity.
Conduct a focused retrospective to help the team to discover the root cause.
Implement a checkpoint in the iteration to verify if the team is on track.

choices.text: In the Procurement Management Plan

In the Service Level Agreement

test.text:
While preparing a project charter for a new project, a project manager reviews lessons learned from previous projects. The lessons learned documents show frequent issues with low engagement levels and stakeholder misalignment on project objectives.
What should the project manager do to avoid repetition of this issue in the new project?

choices.text: Allow any stakeholder to join the change control board (CCB) at any time in the project.
Include all stakeholders in the responsibility assignment matrix (RAM) for acceptance of the deliverables.
Gather all the requirements provided by every individual stakeholder and include in the work breakdown structure (WBS).
Build a common understanding among stakeholders about key deliverables described in the approved project charter.

A newly-hired project manager is running a project for the first time and is worried about rising tensions. Project team members are arguing during an effort-intensive phase and stakeholders have voiced some doubts about the project's performance. In a discussion with a senior project manager, the new project manager admits that they have a fear of conflict and asks the senior project manager how they perceive conflict.
How should the senior project manager respond?

choices.text: Conflict in projects is inevitable - focus on managing it.
Conflict in projects is preventable - replan the mitigation.
Conflict in projects is disastrous - prepare a recovery plan.
Conflict in projects is healthy - refrain from interfering.

choices.text: The NPV for Project A is -$21,62.75, and for Project B is -$1,5.3. The project manager should recommend Project B because it has a lower NPV.
